alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 4:59AM PDT until November 05 at 3:29PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain ended over the area late Friday. No hydrologically significant rain is forecast for the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 202.5 feet, flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Flooding in some areas may be deep and hazardous especially near rivers. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork Roads. A stage of 202.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 202.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage and crest near 202.9 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning and continue to recede this afternoon. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
